document.masterDocTitle: The genus Notophthiracarus of New Zealand (Acari: Oribatida: Phthiracaridae): three new species and a key to 24 described species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Notophthiracarus of New Zealand (Acari: Oribatida: Phthiracaridae): three new species and a key to 24 described species

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Notophthiracarus
reported from New Zealand

paragraph.keyLead:
1 16 pairs of notogastral setae present........................................
N. comatus
Niedbała, 2000

2 Notogaster with anterior cowl............................................
N. tripartitus
Niedbała, 1989
3 Prodorsum with strong and crown-like median crista............................................... 4
- Notogaster without strong and crown-like median crista............................................ 6

4 Notogastral setae phylliform...........................................
N. perlucundus
Niedbała, 2000

5 Lamellar and rostral setae thin and smooth; setae v’ on femora I absent...................
N. whakau sp. nov.

- Lamellar and rostral setae thin and smooth; setae v’ on femora I present........
N. unicarinatus
Niedbała, 2000

7 Lateral carinae present; in > ex > ro ..........................................
N. brachys
Niedbała, 2006

- Lateral carinae absent; ex > ro > in ............................................
N. atratus
Niedbała, 2000

- Setae ad 1 and ad 2 vestigial..............................................
N. caliginosus
Niedbała, 1989

11 Lamellar setae vestigial; notogastral setae more or less similar in length...........
N. repostus
Niedbała, 1989

- Lamellar setae not vestigial; notogastral setae heterotrichy in length..................
N. ater
Niedbała, 2000

13 Prodorsum with median crista........................................
N. paracapillatus
Niedbała, 2006

14 Dorsal region of sigillar fields strong and bifurcate anteriorly; posterior furrows present..........................................................................................
N. quietus
Niedbała, 1989

- Dorsal region of sigillar fields weak and not bifurcate anteriorly; posterior furrows absent.....................................................................................
N. rotoitiensis
Niedbała, 2006

16 Interlamellar setae short and fine, slightly longer than lamellar setae............
N. conspicuus
Niedbała, 1989
- Interlamellar setae long and thick, more than twice longer than lamellar setae........................... 17

17 Lamellar setae minute, much shorter than interlamellar setae; setae ad 3 thin and minute, similar to genital setae.................................................................
N. incomparabilis
Niedbała, 2000

- Lamellar setae longer, about 1 / 3 long of interlamellar setae; setae ad 3 thicker and longer than genital setae.........................................................................
N. uncinulus
Niedbała, 2000

18 Notogastral setae heterotrichy in length.....................................
N. fecundus
Niedbała, 2000
- Notogastral setae more or less similar in length................................................... 19

19 Notogastral setae flagellate............................................
N. bonangensis
Niedbała, 2006
20 Notogastral setae short ( c 1 /c 1 – d 1 < 0.5 ), spiniform and rough......................................... 21

21 Interlamellar setae long, almost 4 times longer than lamellar setae.................
N. aquilus
Niedbała, 2000

- Interlamellar setae not so long, slightly longer than lamellar setae.................
N. maurus
Niedbała, 2000

22 Setae ad 3 thicker and longer than genital setae....................................
N. matatatipu
sp. nov.
- Setae ad 3 thin and minute, similar to genital setae................................................. 23

23 Pedicel of sensilli longer than head; setae ps 4 situated anterior to setae ad 1 ..........
N. claviger
Niedbała, 1993

- Pedicel of sensilli shorter than head; setae ps 4 situated posterior to setae ad 1 ..............
N. dugdalei
sp. nov.
